body:
# Rosetta

A blazing fast internationalization (i18n) library for Crystal with compile-time key lookup. You'll never have a `missing translation` in your app, ever again. ![GitHub](https://img.shields.io/github/license/wout/rosetta) ![GitHub tag (latest SemVer)](https://img.shields.io/github/v/tag/wout/rosetta) ![GitHub Workflow Status](https://img.shields.io/github/workflow/status/wout/rosetta/Rosetta%20CI) ## Why use Rosetta? ### You'll never have a missing translation Rosetta is different from other internationalization libraries because it handles key lookup at compile-time rather than runtime. The significant advantage is that you'll be able to find missing translations - or typos in your locale keys - during development rather than after you've deployed your app. This is also true for translation keys in all additional locales. ### You'll never have a missing interpolation In Rosetta, interpolation keys are arguments to the translation method. So if you're missing an argument, the compiler will complain. The parser will also compare interpolation keys in additional locales to the ones found in the default locale, and complain if some are missing. ### Rosetta is 10x faster than similar libraries Benchmarking against other libraries which also use YAML or JSON backends, Rosetta is about 10x faster than any other one. For simple translations: ``` crimson-knight/i18n.cr translation 147.72k ( 6.77µs) (± 3.36%) 0.99kB/op 178.77× slower crystal-i18n/i18n translation 2.25M (443.68ns) (± 3.44%) 48.0B/op 11.05× slower syeopite/lens translation 1.10M (912.67ns) (± 7.10%) 176B/op 22.72× slower wout/rosetta translation 24.89M ( 40.17ns) (± 6.59%) 0.0B/op fastest ``` For translations with interpolations: ``` crimson-knight/i18n.cr interpolation 145.50k ( 6.87µs) (± 4.47%) 0.99kB/op 23.12× slower crystal-i18n/i18n interpolation 138.84k ( 7.20µs) (± 4.16%) 2.05kB/op 21.23× slower syeopite/lens interpolation 314.68k ( 3.18µs) (± 7.30%) 561B/op 9.29× slower wout/rosetta interpolation 2.95M (339.26ns) (± 7.17%) 80.0B/op fastest ``` Rosetta is that much faster because a lot of the hard work happens at compile-time. And because the majority of the data is stored on the [stack rather than the heap](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/79923/what-and-where-are-the-stack-and-heap), out of the scope of garbage collector. Read more on [the official docs page](https://wout.github.io/rosetta/latest). ## Installation 1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`: ```yaml dependencies: rosetta: github: wout/rosetta ``` 2. Run `shards install` 3. Run `bin/rosetta --init` 4. Require the generated config file: ```cr # e.g. src/app_name.cr require "../config/rosetta" ``` 5. Include the `Rosetta::Translatable` mixin: ```cr # e.g. src/pages/main_layout.cr include Rosetta::Translatable ``` 6. Localize your app ```cr Rosetta.locale = :es class Hello::ShowPage < MainLayout def content h1 r("welcome_message").t(name: "Brian") # => "¡Hola Brian!" end end ``` Read more on [the official docs page](https://wout.github.io/rosetta/latest). ## To-do - [x] Add specs for the existing code - [x] Make settings accessible to the compiler - [x] Send `default_locale` and `available_locales` to the parser - [x] Implement key comparison between available locales in the parser - [x] Add compiler error messages for mismatching keys - [x] Implement inferred locale keys at macro level - [x] Interpolation (with %{} tag for interpolation keys) - [x] Check existence of interpolation keys in all translations at compile-time - [x] Translatable mixin - [x] Localization of numeric values - [x] Localization of date and time values - [x] Localizable mixin - [x] Locale exceptions - [x] Add setup scripts - [x] Pluralization (with one/many/other/count/... convention) - [ ] Implement fallbacks ## Development Make sure you have [Guardian.cr](https://github.com/f/guardian) installed. Then run: ```bash $ guardian ``` This will automatically: - run ameba for src and spec files - run the relevant spec for any file in src - run spec file whenever they are saved - install shards whenever you save shard.yml ## Documentation - [Reference](https://wout.github.io/rosetta/latest) - [API Docs](https://wout.github.io/rosetta/api/main) ## Contributing 1. Fork it () 2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`) 3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`) 4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`) 5. Create a new Pull Request ## Contributors - [wout](https://github.com/wout) - creator and maintainer ## Acknowledgements This shard pulls inpiration from the following projects: - [crimson-knight/i18n.cr](https://github.com/crimson-knight/i18n.cr) - [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n) - [syeopite/lens](https://github.com/syeopite/lens) - [Rails](https://github.com/rails/rails)

types.name: AllowedInTags
types.doc:
Objects including this module can safely be used in Lucky as a value for html
tags, without the need to explicitly convert them to a string.
types.summary: Objects including this module can safely be used in Lucky as a value for html tags, without the need to explicitly convert them to a string.

class_methods.name: distance_of_time_in_words
class_methods.doc:
Returns a `String` with approximate distance in time between `from` and
`to`. For example:

```
Rosetta.distance_of_time_in_words(
  Time.utc(2021, 10, 15, 8, 0, 0),
  Time.utc(2021, 10, 15, 8, 0, 5))
)
# => "5 seconds"
```

Most of the code for this method is borrowed from Lucky.
class_methods.summary: Returns a String with approximate distance in time between from and to.

def.name: distance_of_time_in_words
def.body:
minutes = (to - from).minutes
seconds = (to - from).seconds
hours = (to - from).hours
days = (to - from).days
if days != 0
  return distance_in_days(days)
end
if hours != 0
  return distance_in_hours(hours)
end
if minutes != 0
  return distance_in_minutes(minutes)
end
distance_in_seconds(seconds)

class_methods.name: interpolate
class_methods.doc:
Interpolates a given string with the values from the given hash or named
tuple.
class_methods.summary: Interpolates a given string with the values from the given hash or named tuple.

def.name: interpolate
def.body:
values.each do |key, value|
  translation = if value.is_a?(Time)
    localize_time(value, translation)
  else
    if value.is_a?(Tuple(Int32, Int32, Int32))
      localize_time(Time.local(*value), translation)
    else
      translation.gsub(/\%\{#{key}\}/, value)
    end
  end
end
translation

class_methods.name: locale
class_methods.doc:
Gets the current locale at runtime using the config instance stored in the
current fiber.
class_methods.summary: Gets the current locale at runtime using the config instance stored in the current fiber.

class_methods.name: locale=
class_methods.doc:
Sets the current locale at runtime using the config instance stored in the
current fiber.
class_methods.summary: Sets the current locale at runtime using the config instance stored in the current fiber.

class_methods.name: localize_time
class_methods.doc:
Uses a given format to localize a given Time object, for example:

```
Rosetta.localize_time(Time.local, "%d %b %Y %H:%M:%S")
```
class_methods.summary: Uses a given format to localize a given Time object, for example:

class_methods.name: pluralize
class_methods.args_string: (count : Float | Int, translation : NamedTuple, rule : Pluralization::Rule = Pluralization::RULES[Rosetta.locale].new)
class_methods.args_html: (count : Float | Int, translation : NamedTuple, rule : Pluralization::Rule = Pluralization::RULES[Rosetta.locale].new)

def.name: pluralize
def.body:
if (count == 0) && translation[:zero]?
  return translation[:zero]?.to_s
end
translation[rule.apply(count)]

class_methods.name: time_ago_in_words
class_methods.doc:
Returns a `String` with approximate distance in time between `from` and
current moment.

```
time_ago_in_words(Time.utc(2019, 8, 30))
# => "about a month"
# gives the same result as:
distance_of_time_in_words(Time.utc(2019, 8, 30), Time.utc)
# => "about a month"
```

See more examples in `#distance_of_time_in_words`.
class_methods.summary: Returns a String with approximate distance in time between from and current moment.

class_methods.name: time_from_now_in_words
class_methods.doc:
Returns a `String` with approximate distance in time between current
moment and future date.

```
time_from_now_in_words(Time.utc(2022, 8, 30))
# => "about a year"
# gives the same result as:
distance_of_time_in_words(Time.utc, Time.utc(2022, 8, 30))
# => "about a year"
```

See more examples in `#distance_of_time_in_words`.
class_methods.summary: Returns a String with approximate distance in time between current moment and future date.

def.name: with_locale
def.body:
begin
  current_locale = Rosetta.locale
  Rosetta.locale = locale
  yield
ensure
  Rosetta.locale = current_locale || default_locale
end

macros.name: available_locales
macros.doc:
Tries to find the available locales configurad by the user. If it's not set,
the available locales defined in the config class is used.
macros.summary: Tries to find the available locales configurad by the user.

macros.name: date
macros.doc:
Localizes a date, for example:

```
Rosetta.date.t(Time.local)
Rosetta.date.t({2021, 8, 20})
Rosetta.date(:long).l(Time.local)
Rosetta.date("%a, %d %b %Y").l(Time.local.date)
```

def.name: date

macros.name: default_locale
macros.doc:
Tries to find the default locale configurad by the user. If it's not set,
the default locale defined in the config class is used.
macros.summary: Tries to find the default locale configurad by the user.

def.name: default_locale

macros.name: find
macros.doc:
Finds the translations for the given key as a dedicated class instance for
the translation, which inherits from `Rosetta::Translation`.

If the key does not exist, a compile error will be raised.
macros.summary: Finds the translations for the given key as a dedicated class instance for the translation, which inherits from Rosetta::Translation.

def.name: find

macros.name: number
macros.doc:
Localizes a numeric value, for example:

```
Rosetta.number.t(123_456.789)
Rosetta.number(:custom).l(123_456.789)
```

def.name: number

macros.name: time
macros.doc:
Localizes time, for example:

```
Rosetta.time.t(Time.local)
Rosetta.time(:short).l(Time.local)
Rosetta.time("%d %b %Y %H:%M:%S").l(Time.local)
```

def.name: time

macros.name: load
macros.doc:
Loads the parsed set of locales from the given path. This macro should be
called in an initializer:

```
Rosetta::Backend.load("config/locales")
```
macros.summary: Loads the parsed set of locales from the given path.

def.name: load
def.body:
{% if Rosetta.has_constant?("DEFAULT_LOCALE")
  default_locale = Rosetta::DEFAULT_LOCALE
else
  default_locale = Rosetta::Config::DEFAULT_LOCALE
end %}


      
{% if Rosetta.has_constant?("AVAILABLE_LOCALES")
  available_locales = Rosetta::AVAILABLE_LOCALES
else
  available_locales = Rosetta::Config::AVAILABLE_LOCALES
end %}


      
{% rules = Rosetta::Pluralization.constant("DEFAULT_RULES")
if Rosetta.has_constant?("PLURALIZATION_RULES")
  Rosetta::PLURALIZATION_RULES.each do |locale, rule|
    rules[locale] = rule
  end
end
 %}


      Rosetta::Pluralization::RULES = 
{{ rules }}


      
{% pluralization_rules = [] of String
pluralization_tags = [] of String
available_locales.each do |locale|
  rule = rules[locale]
  unless rule
    raise("No pluralization rule is defined for \"#{locale.id}\"")
  end
  rule = rule.resolve
  anno = rule.annotation(Rosetta::Pluralization::CategoryTags)
  if anno
    pluralization_tags.push("  #{rule}: [#{(anno.args.join(',')).id}]")
  else
    raise("#{rule} is missing a CategoryTags annotation")
  end
  pluralization_rules.push("  #{locale.id}: #{rule}")
end
 %}


      
{% yaml = "path: #{path.id}\ndefault_locale: #{default_locale.id}\navailable_locales: [#{(available_locales.join(',')).id}]\npluralization_rules:\n#{(pluralization_rules.join("\n")).id}\npluralization_tags:\n#{(pluralization_tags.uniq.join("\n")).id}"
translations = run("./runner", yaml)
if !(translations.stringify.starts_with?("module Rosetta"))
  raise(translations.stringify)
end
 %}


      
{{ translations }}

Gets the current locale or falls back to the default locale if it's not
defined.

available locales.

instance_methods.name: t_hash
instance_methods.doc:
Using a hash for interpolation is considered unsafe since the content of
hashes can't be checked at compile-time. Try to avoid using this method if
you can.
instance_methods.summary: Using a hash for interpolation is considered unsafe since the content of hashes can't be checked at compile-time.

types.name: LocalizedNumber
types.doc:
LocalizedNumber is similar to a Translation object; it implements a similar
interface but its sole purpose is to localize numeric objects.
types.summary: LocalizedNumber is similar to a Translation object; it implements a similar interface but its sole purpose is to localize numeric objects.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (separator : String | Char, delimiter : String | Char, decimal_places : Int32, group : Int32, only_significant : Bool)
constructors.args_html: (separator : String | Char, delimiter : String | Char, decimal_places : Int32, group : Int32, only_significant : Bool)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(separator, delimiter, decimal_places, group, only_significant)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: l
instance_methods.args_string: (number : Number, separator : String | Char = @separator, delimiter : String | Char = @delimiter, decimal_places : Int32 = @decimal_places, group : Int32 = @group, only_significant : Bool = @only_significant)
instance_methods.args_html: (number : Number, separator : String | Char = @separator, delimiter : String | Char = @delimiter, decimal_places : Int32 = @decimal_places, group : Int32 = @group, only_significant : Bool = @only_significant)

def.name: l
def.body: number.format(separator: separator, delimiter: delimiter, decimal_places: decimal_places, group: group, only_significant: only_significant)

instance_methods.doc: Returns a list of self-containing translation modules.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a list of self-containing translation modules.

def.name: parse!
def.body:
builder = Builder.new(default_locale)
if translations.empty?
  return builder.build_locales(translations)
end
if valid_key_set?
else
  return error.to_s
end
builder.build_locales(processed_translations)

instance_methods.summary: Builds the wrapping module for all translation structs.

types.name: CategoryTags
types.doc: Define required category tags using this annotation.
types.summary: Define required category tags using this annotation.

types.name: Rule
types.doc:
Abstract pluralization rule.

A pluralization rule struct provides a main `#rule` method that, given a
`count` number, returns the corresponding plural category tag, which
should be part of the common plural category tags defined
[by the CLDR](http://cldr.unicode.org/index/cldr-spec/plural-rules):

`:zero`, `:one`, `:two`, `:few`, `:many` and `:other`.

def.name: new
def.body:
x = allocate
if x.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(x)
end
x

types.name: Arabic
types.doc:
Arabic pluralization rule.

This rule was extracted from [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n).

def.name: apply
def.body:
mod100 = count % 100
if count == 0
  :zero
else
  if count == 1
    :one
  else
    if count == 2
      :two
    else
      if FROM_3_TO_10.includes?(mod100)
        :few
      else
        if FROM_11_TO_99.includes?(mod100)
          :many
        else
          :other
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

types.name: Breton
types.doc:
Breton pluralization rule.

This rule was extracted from [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n).

def.name: apply
def.body:
mod10 = count % 10
mod100 = count % 100
if (mod10 == 1) && (!([11, 71, 91].includes?(mod100)))
  :one
else
  if (mod10 == 2) && (!([12, 72, 92].includes?(mod100)))
    :two
  else
    if ([3, 4, 9].includes?(mod10)) && (!((((10..19).to_a + (70..79).to_a) + (90..99).to_a).includes?(mod100)))
      :few
    else
      if ((count % 1000000) == 0) && (count != 0)
        :many
      else
        :other
      end
    end
  end
end

types.name: CentralMoroccoTamazight
types.doc:
Central Morocco Tamazight pluralization rule.

types.name: Colognian
types.doc:
Colognian pluralization rule.

This rule was extracted from [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n).

def.name: apply
def.body:
if count == 0
  :zero
else
  if count == 1
    :one
  else
    :other
  end
end

types.name: EastSlavic
types.doc:
Pluralization rule used for: Belarusian, Bosnian, Croatian, Russian, Serbian, Serbo-Croatian, Ukrainian.

This rule was extracted from [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n).
types.summary: Pluralization rule used for: Belarusian, Bosnian, Croatian, Russian, Serbian, Serbo-Croatian, Ukrainian.

def.name: apply
def.body:
mod10 = count % 10
mod100 = count % 100
if (mod10 == 1) && (mod100 != 11)
  :one
else
  if (FROM_2_TO_4.includes?(mod10)) && (!(FROM_12_TO_14.includes?(mod100)))
    :few
  else
    if ((mod10 == 0) || (FROM_5_TO_9.includes?(mod10))) || (FROM_11_TO_14.includes?(mod100))
      :many
    else
      :other
    end
  end
end

types.name: Irish
types.doc:
Irish pluralization rule.

This rule was extracted from [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n).

def.name: apply
def.body:
if count == 1
  :one
else
  if count == 2
    :two
  else
    if FROM_3_TO_6.includes?(count)
      :few
    else
      if FROM_7_TO_10.includes?(count)
        :many
      else
        :other
      end
    end
  end
end

types.name: Langi
types.doc:
Langi pluralization rule.

This rule was extracted from [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n).

def.name: apply
def.body:
if count == 0
  :zero
else
  if count > 0 && count < 2
    :one
  else
    :other
  end
end

types.name: Polish
types.doc:
Polish pluralization rule.

This rule was extracted from [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n).

def.name: apply
def.body:
mod10 = count % 10
mod100 = count % 100
if count == 1
  :one
else
  if ([2, 3, 4].includes?(mod10)) && (!([12, 13, 14].includes?(mod100)))
    :few
  else
    if (([0, 1] + (5..9).to_a).includes?(mod10)) || ([12, 13, 14].includes?(mod100))
      :many
    else
      :other
    end
  end
end

types.name: Romanian
types.doc:
Romanian pluralization rule.

This rule was extracted from [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n).

def.name: apply
def.body:
if count == 1
  :one
else
  if (count == 0) || ((1..19).to_a.includes?(count % 100))
    :few
  else
    :other
  end
end

types.name: ScottishGaelic
types.doc:
Scottish gaelic pluralization rule.

This rule was extracted from [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n).

def.name: apply
def.body:
if (count == 1) || (count == 11)
  :one
else
  if (count == 2) || (count == 12)
    :two
  else
    if (FROM_3_TO_10 + FROM_13_TO_19).includes?(count)
      :few
    else
      :other
    end
  end
end

types.name: Slovenian
types.doc:
Slovenian pluralization rule.

This rule was extracted from [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n).

def.name: apply
def.body:
mod100 = count % 100
if mod100 == 1
  :one
else
  if mod100 == 2
    :two
  else
    if (mod100 == 3) || (mod100 == 4)
      :few
    else
      :other
    end
  end
end

types.doc:
Upper sorbian pluralization rule.

This rule was extracted from [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n).

def.name: apply
def.body:
mod100 = count % 100
if mod100 == 1
  :one
else
  if mod100 == 2
    :two
  else
    if (mod100 == 3) || (mod100 == 4)
      :few
    else
      :other
    end
  end
end

types.name: Welsh
types.doc:
Welsh pluralization rule.

This rule was extracted from [crystal-i18n/i18n](https://github.com/crystal-i18n/i18n).

def.name: apply
def.body:
case count
when 0
  :zero
when 1
  :one
when 2
  :two
when 3
  :few
when 6
  :many
else
  :other
end

types.doc:

def.name: apply
def.body:
if count == 1
  :one
else
  if FROM_2_TO_4.includes?(count)
    :few
  else
    :other
  end
end

types.name: PluralizedTranslation
types.doc: Methods for translations with pluralizable values.

instance_methods.name: t_hash
instance_methods.doc:
Using a hash for interpolation is considered unsafe since the content of
hashes can't be checked at compile-time. Try to avoid using this method if
you can.
instance_methods.summary: Using a hash for interpolation is considered unsafe since the content of hashes can't be checked at compile-time.

def.name: t_hash
def.body:
if count = values["count"]?
else
  message = "Missing \"count\" from interpolation values"
  raise(InterpolationArgumentException.new(message))
end
Rosetta.interpolate(Rosetta.pluralize(count.to_s.to_i, raw), values)

types.name: SimpleTranslation
types.doc: Methods for translations without interpolations.

types.name: Translatable
types.doc: Include this module in any class where you need to translate many keys.
types.summary: Include this module in any class where you need to translate many keys.

macros.name: r
macros.doc:
Finds the translation for the given key. If the given key starts with a
".", a prefix based on the current class name will be used. Unless a
`Rosetta::Translatable::Config` annotation is defined with a value for
`prefix`, which will then be used instead.

@[Rosetta::Translatable::Config(prefix: "user")]
class Person
  include Rosetta::Translatable

  def greeting
    r(".welcome_message").t # => key resolves to "user.welcome_message"
  end
end
macros.summary: Finds the translation for the given key.

def.name: r

types.name: Translation
types.doc: Base struct for translation values.

def.name: new
def.body:
x = allocate
if x.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(x)
end
x

instance_methods.name: raw
instance_methods.doc: Return the raw translation value for the current locale.
instance_methods.summary: Return the raw translation value for the current locale.

types.name: VariantsTranslation
types.doc: Methods for translations with variants.

instance_methods.name: t_hash
instance_methods.doc:
Using a hash for interpolation is considered unsafe since the content of
hashes can't be checked at compile-time. Try to avoid using this method if
you can.
instance_methods.summary: Using a hash for interpolation is considered unsafe since the content of hashes can't be checked at compile-time.

def.name: t_hash
def.body:
if variant = values["variant"]?
else
  message = "Missing \"variant\" from interpolation values"
  raise(InterpolationArgumentException.new(message))
end
Rosetta.interpolate(raw[variant], values)
